outcome: /JUDGMENT CC 372/2023 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS -IV, KOZHIKODE PETITIONER/ACCUSED: BASITH AGED 27 YEARS S/0 ABU, UC HOUSE , KODUVALLI, KOZHIKKODE CITY, PIN - 673572 BY ADV SUNNY MATHEW RES
full_text: o] ms he 4 2024/KER/4378 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MRS. JUSTICE SOPHY THOMAS WEDNESDAY, THE 1741 DAY OF JANUARY 2024 / 27TH POUSHA, 1945 CRL.MC NO. 152 OF 2024 CRIME NO.9/2023 OF Nadakkavu Police Station, Kozhikode AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT CC 372/2023 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS -IV, KOZHIKODE PETITIONER/ACCUSED: BASITH AGED 27 YEARS S/0 ABU, UC HOUSE , KODUVALLI, KOZHIKKODE CITY, PIN - 673572 BY ADV SUNNY MATHEW RESPONDENTS/COMPLAINANT/STATE: 1 MEGHA AGED 27 YEARS D/O ANILKUMAR, PAVITHRAM, KARALINK ROAD, KARAPARAMBA, KOZHIKKODE CITY, KERALA-, PIN - 673586 2 THE STATION HOUSE OFFICER NADAKKAVU POLICE STATION KOZHIKKODE-, PIN - 682031 3 THE STATE OF KERALA REP. BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM, PIN - 682023 OTHER PRESENT: PP-SRI.PRASANTH M.P. THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 17.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: BIER 2024/KER/4378 CRL.MC NO.152 OF 2024 2 ORDER This Crl.M.C. under Section 482 of Cr.P.C. is filed by the accused in Crime No.9/2023 of Nadakkavu Police Station, Kozhikode, registered under Sections 354D(1){i), 354D(1)(ii) and 506 of IPC, for quashing Annexure-Al_ final report in C.C.No.372/2023, on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-lV, Kozhikode. 2. The prosecution allegation is that, despite the protest of the defacto complainant, the accused followed her through mobile phone and Whatsapp from the month of November 2022, and he sent her photos taken together with the accused to her parents and on 03.01.2023, he created an Instagram account in her name and posted her photos with him, and also threatened her by sending messages. 3. When the matter is taken up for consideration, learned counsel for the petitioner would submit that the matter stands settled, and he produced Annexure-A2 affidavit of the 1* respondent, endorsing the factum of settlement, and stating that, she has no intention to continue with the prosecution. She has no objection in quashing the proceedings in C.C.No.372/2023 pending against the petitioner before Judicial First Class BIER 2024/KER/4378 CRL.MC NO.152 OF 2024 3 Magistrate Court-IV, Kozhikode. 4. Learned Public Prosecutor on instructions submitted that the matter has been settled, and he produced the signed statement of the 1* respondent, stating that as the matter is settled, she has no objection in quashing the proceedings in C.C.No.372/2023. 5. Since the matter stands settled, no purpose would be served by continuing the prosecution against the petitioner. 6. In the light of the principles laid down by the Apex Court in Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and Another; [(2012) 10 SCC 303)], and State of Madhya Pradesh v. Laxmi Narayan and Others; [(2019) 5 SCC 688], this Court is of the view that the proceedings against the petitioner can be quashed on the basis of settlement. Moreover, the dispute is purely personal in nature, and no public interest is involved in it. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-A1 final report in C.C.No.372/2023 on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-lV, Kozhikode, stands quashed. Sd/- SOPHY THOMAS JUDGE ska ak eas 2024/KER/4378 CRL.MC NO.152 OF 2024 4 APPENDIX OF CRL.MC 152/2024 PETITIONER ANNEXURES Annexure-A 1 CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN IN C.C.372/2023 ON THE FILE OF THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT-IV, KOZHIKKODE Annexure A2 TRUE COPY OF THE AFFIDAVIT SWORN TO BY THE 1ST RESPONDENT DATED 18.12.2023
